Our secondary got much better with Landon Collins who was an absolutely critical grab in the draft, adding him to Amukamara and DRC, another rookie Mykkele Thompson who could also be a great sleeper rookie in our secondary, our running back corps is good, Jennings and Williams are bruiser downhill backs which I like and have proven to be the better backs (Marshawn vs McCoy, for example) when needing to do workhorse work. We also have Vereen who adds a pass catching dynamic out of the backfield that we haven't had in years , Eli had the best statistical season of his career last year but because the Giants sucked no one noticed, and that was the first season playing with a completely new offensive scheme so this year should be much much better. He threw for 4,400 yards (6th in the league), 30 TDs and 14 picks, with a new playbook and only two guys to throw to. I like Donnell at tight end, and Fells is okay. Our only problems are depth in injury-prone positions like O-line/linebackers/secondary. For example, last year our secondary got crapped on because Thurmond, our nickel back, tore his pec in week 2 and was out the whole season so everything just got screwey. But the potential is there for us to have an 11-5 season and make a playoff run

data.name: Over/Under: Will Rashad Jennings have 30 catches?

data.message: If he gets 25 and Vereen gets 55-60,Williams hets 10-15....along with Eli's weapons and this offense....Eli could have an off the charts passer rating for once...(not that passer ratings win super bowls,but if he had a monster MVP type year in a super bowl run....the haters will finally go away)
Under. Vereen will get most of the backfield catches.

I don't know. Jennings may be the projected starter, but look for Vereen to bring some value to. Jennings & Vereen should take off some pressure in the coverage. Also keep eyes on Rueben Randle & Donnell. While Cruz & Beckham Jr should get a lot of attention, many are gonna forget about these two. If the O-Line can hold up, Manning & Giants should have a solid season on offense.

Defensively, I'm not too worried despite the JPP issue. Steve Spagnula is a smart man, he can build a defense from nothing into something. So, they'll be fine there. May not rank of the best in the league, but the defense didn't fully come together overnight on the road to SuperBowl XLII either.
